topics.body:
*Some* news: totally fucking called it.

Before someone gets up in arms about this keep in mind I'm *JUST* talking about economics here for a second and don't confuse this for a political view, but basically what is happening in the news right now is you remember how about a year ago there was that massive school shooting that everyone went nuts about and liberals were trying to pass a required background check law and conservatives killed it and how everyone and their mom were going out buying guns for fear of "Obama's going to take my gun!"?  Well the inevitable economic effects of over saturation have kicked in; basically gun manufacturers are massively slashing production because the market is massively oversaturated with guns and as a result sellers can't sell and the majority of stores can't get rid of their stock.  Sellers have pretty much stopped ordering new guns until they can clear their current stock and as a result manufacturers have halved production.


Tl:dr; the gun market is massively over-saturated and as a result manufacturers have massively cut production and sellers have stopped ordering.

How long is this going to last?  Don't know; all I know is that it's going to be a long ass time before the market not necessarily stabilizes so much as stops being over-saturated.

Tl:dr of everything: gun market bubble is bursting hard.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
